item.title: Montreal, Winnipeg moving AHL franchises, OHL team headed to Hamilton
item.description:
The Montreal Canadiens and Winnipeg Jets are moving their American Hockey League affiliates and the Ontario Hockey League's Belleville Bulls will play in Hamilton, Ontario, next season.
Montreal is shifting its AHL team from Hamilton to St. J...

item.title: Rangers' Klein out 3-4 weeks with upper-body injury
item.description:
New York Rangers defenseman Kevin Klein will miss 3-4 weeks because of an upper-body injury, the Rangers announced Thursday.
Klein, who sustained the injury blocking a shot by Alex Ovechkin on Wednesday in a 3-1 win against the Washington Capit...

item.title: Anaheim Ducks send Josh Manson to minors with Vatanen, Beleskey nearing returns from injury
item.description:
ANAHEIM, Calif. - The Anaheim Ducks have reassigned defenceman Josh Manson to the minors with Matt Beleskey and Sami Vatanen nearing return from injury.
The Ducks announced the move Thursday.
Manson has three assists in 28 games with Anahe...

item.title: Sharks' Torres hopes to continue career after surgery
item.description:
SAN JOSE -- San Jose Sharks forward Raffi Torres, two weeks removed from the third major right-knee surgery of his career, said he's encouraged he'll be able to return to the NHL next season.
"Yeah, big-time," Torres said. "I've had a chance to...

item.title: OHL approves relocation and ownership transfer of Belleville Bulls to Hamilton
item.description:
TORONTO - The Belleville Bulls will be moving to Steeltown later this year.
The Ontario Hockey League's Board of Governors approved the relocation of the franchise to Hamilton starting in the 2015-'16 season, the OHL said Thursday in a releas...

item.title: Canadiens, Jets moving AHL teams next season
item.description:
The American Hockey League announced Thursday that Montreal Canadiens ownership, Club de Hockey Canadien Inc., acquired and then relocated the Hamilton Bulldogs to St. John's and will begin play there in the 2015-16 season.
"We are delighted in...

item.title: Islanders' Boychuk agrees to terms on new contract
item.description:
The New York Islanders announced Thursday that defenseman Johnny Boychuk has agreed to terms on a seven-year contract.
Financial details of the contract were not released, but Newsday reported it's worth $42 million, for a $6 million annual ave...

item.title: Flyers sign forward Bardreau to entry-level contract
item.description:
The Philadelphia Flyers have signed forward Cole Bardreau to a three-year entry-level contract beginning with the start of the 2015-16 season, according to general manager Ron Hextall.
Bardreau, 21, recently completed a four-year career at Cor...

item.title: Columbus Blue Jackets activate defenceman Ryan Murray after missing 5 weeks with ankle sprain
item.description:
COLUMBUS, Ohio - The Columbus Blue Jackets have activated defenceman Ryan Murray off injured reserve after he missed five weeks with a high ankle sprain.
Murray was hurt in a game against St. Louis on Feb. 6.
The 21-year-old picked No. 2 o...

item.title: Parenteau returns to Canadiens lineup after agent tweets: Therrien says timing right
item.description:
BROSSARD, Que. - Coach Michel Therrien gave a sly smile when asked if Pierre-Alexandre Parenteau's return to the Montreal Canadiens lineup had anything to do with a tweet sent by his agent.

item.title: Rangers' Klein to meet with doctor after shot block
item.description:
New York Rangers defenseman Kevin Klein has returned to New York to meet with a team physician after blocking a shot Wednesday against the Washington Capitals, the Rangers announced Thursday.
Klein blocked an Alex Ovechkin shot in the final min...

item.title: Maple Leafs recall defenseman Brennan from AHL
item.description:
The Toronto Maple Leafs announced today that defenseman TJ Brennan has been recalled from the Toronto Marlies (AHL).
Brennan, 25, has skated in five regular season games with the Toronto Marlies this season, collecting one assist. Prior to bein...

item.title: Islanders' Leddy will miss at least two weeks: report
item.description:
New York Islanders defenseman Nick Leddy will be out at least two weeks because of an upper-body injury, according to Newsday.
Leddy was injured during the second period of the Islanders' game Monday against the Toronto Maple Leafs, and he did ...

item.title: WHL Roundup: Bjorkstrand, Henry lead Winterhawks over Silvertips
item.description:
EVERETT, Wash. - Oliver Bjorkstrand and Adam Henry each had a pair of goals as the Portland Winterhawks downed the host Everett Silvertips 6-1 on Wednesday in Western Hockey League action.

item.description:

item.title: Gaudreau, Stajan each score twice as Flames double up Ducks 6-3
item.description:
CALGARY - Johnny Gaudreau and Matt Stajan had two goals each to lead the Calgary Flames to a 6-3 win over the Anaheim Ducks on Wednesday.
Sean Monahan and Jiri Hudler also scored for the Flames (37-25-5), who returned to play at the Scotiaban...

item.title: Cousins nets hat trick, adds an assist as Phantoms toppled Marlies 4-3
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Backman scores a pair of goals to lead Monarchs past IceCaps 4-1
item.description:

item.title: Roberts to work with new sports performance center
item.description:
Former NHL player Gary Roberts announced plans Wednesday for a familiar role of off-ice instruction in his return to Pennsylvania.
He will be the coordinator of the Sports Performance Center at the UPMC Lemieux Sports Complex in Cranberry Town...

item.title: Blues' Shattenkirk on track in recovery from surgery
item.description:
ST. LOUIS -- Kevin Shattenkirk admitted the play was rather innocent.

item.title: Maple Leafs send Nazem Kadri home before practice for missing team meeting
item.description:
TORONTO - In the latest turn in the saga of the Toronto Maple Leafs, forward Nazem Kadri was sent home from practice by an unhappy Peter Horachek for missing a team meeting.

item.title: Panthers' Luongo won't return Thursday: report
item.description:
Florida Panthers goalie Roberto Luongo will miss a third straight game Thursday against the Winnipeg Jets, according to the Miami Herald.
Luongo sustained a shoulder injury March 3 against the Toronto Maple Leafs. He left the game but later ret...

item.title: Maple Leafs to hold Kadri out two more games
item.description:
TORONTO -- Toronto Maple Leafs center Nazem Kadri will not play in their next two games, team president Brendan Shanahan announced Wednesday.
Kadri, 24, was late for a team meeting Sunday and was made a healthy scratch for the Maple Leafs game ...

item.description:

item.title: Johansen's shootout goal leads Blue Jackets over Hurricanes 4-3, hold onto playoff position
item.description:
RALEIGH, N.C. - Ryan Johansen was skating about as slowly as he could when he took the Blue Jackets' final attempt in a shootout with the Carolina Hurricanes.
Then he found his opening.

item.title: McNabb has goal, 2 assists and Quick stops 21 shots as Kings beat Avalanche 5-2
item.description:
DENVER - Brayden McNabb had a goal and two assists, Jonathan Quick stopped 21 shots and the Los Angeles Kings beat Colorado 5-2 on Tuesday night to end the Avalanche's three-game win streak.
Marian Gaborik, Jeff Carter, Kyle Clifford and Jake...

item.title: Lamoriello not on Devils bench but role unchanged
item.description:
ST. PAUL, Minn. -- Lou Lamoriello was not on the bench for the New Jersey Devils on Tuesday against the Minnesota Wild but said his role as co-coach has not changed.
He watched the Devils' 6-2 loss from the press box; co-coaches Adam Oates and ...

item.title: Tuuka Rask makes 39 saves as Bruins beat Sens for third straight win
item.description:
OTTAWA - Tuukka Rask stopped 39 shots to lead the Boston Bruins to a 3-1 win over the Ottawa Senators on Tuesday night.
Ottawa native Ryan Spooner scored twice for the Bruins (34-22-10), who won their third straight. Loui Eriksson added the o...

item.title: Johansen's shootout goal leads Blue Jackets over Hurricanes 4-3, hold onto playoff position
item.description:
RALEIGH, N.C. - Ryan Johansen had the only goal in the shootout, giving the Columbus Blue Jackets a 4-3 win over the Carolina Hurricanes on Tuesday night.
Scott Hartnell had two goals while Rene Bourque added the other for the Blue Jackets. A...

item.title: Eric Tangradi scores in overtime as Bulldogs edge Flames 2-1
item.description:
GLEN FALLS, N.Y. - Eric Tangradi scored the winner 4:47 into overtime and Joey McDonald made 39 saves as the Hamilton Bulldogs edged the host Adirondack Flames 2-1 on Tuesday in American Hockey League action.

item.title: OHL Roundup: Crouse, Bennett lead Frontenacs to fourth straight win

item.title: Fiddler scores winning goal in Dallas Stars 2-1 victory over free-falling Philadelphia Flyers
item.description:
PHILADELPHIA - Vernon Fiddler scored the go-ahead goal late in the third period to lift the Dallas Stars to a 2-1 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers on Tuesday night.
Brett Ritchie also scored for the Stars, who won for just the fourth time...

item.title: Islanders top-line forward Kyle Okposo returns to lineup vs. Rangers following eye surgery
item.description:
UNIONDALE, N.Y. - Top-line forward Kyle Okposo was back in the New York Islanders' lineup Tuesday night for a key matchup against the New York Rangers after missing 22 games following emergency surgery to fix a detached retina.
